section.title: Function
section.p: Specifies the number of bytes of random salt that will be added to users' credentials before hashing them. Random salt has the effect of making it difficult for attackers to decode passwords by constructing rainbow tables.

This property is in effect only if NATIVE or BUILTIN authentication is specified by the derby.authentication.provider property and if the derby.authentication.builtin.algorithm property has a non-null value.

codeblock.b:
-- system-wide property derby.authentication.builtin.saltLength=32
-- database-level property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.authentication.builtin.saltLength', '32');

section.title: Dynamic or static
section.p: Dynamic; the change takes effect immediately. For information about dynamic changes to properties, see .
